messages.title: GET IN TOUCH
messages.content: If you have any questions or if you would like to help in my campaign, please get in touch.

messages.title: Together Against Sepsis
messages.content: Working with Ron Daniels of the UK Sepsis Trust, I set up the All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sepsis to raise awareness and resources to fight this disease.

messages.title: Sarah Setting The Record Straight On School Funding
messages.content: We will increase the schools budget by £4 billion by 2022, more than beating the rate of inflation. Every local pupil will get a basic amount that is at least as much as they are set to receive this year and we will protect the funding for pupils with low prior attainment.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase the schools budget by £4 billion by 2022, ensuring that every local pupil receives at least the same basic amount as they are set to receive in the current year and protecting funding for pupils with low prior attainment.

issues.education: Increase the schools budget by £4 billion by 2022, ensuring that every local pupil receives at least the same basic amount as they are set to receive in the current year and protecting funding for pupils with low prior attainment.
issues.health: Addresses sepsis by working with Ron Daniels of the UK Sepsis Trust and setting up the All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sepsis to raise awareness and resources to tackle this disease.

endorsements.endorsement: When I first moved here to attend university, Sarah helped me overcome the difficulties I experienced with accommodation. I have now settled here, and I happily recommend Sarah to continue as our MP.

About four years ago I started getting 'blocked', a condition which is a result of having had a major stroke. The local hospital couldn't help me within a timeframe suitable for my condition. This is when I sought Sarah's help and through her persistence managed to secure the treatment I required within the timeframe I needed. I'm very grateful; I was happy to help.

images.caption: Sarah Newton and Theresa May standing up for Britain.
Sarah Newton with constituents and local organizations.
